Name: Frequency - At least ten (10) working days prior to commencement of cold planing operations
Acceptance Criteria - List, including details, of all plant and equipment to be used for the cold planing work.
Record of conformity - Aconex Submission / This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
1.2 - Contractor's check that cold planing plant in full working order
Acceptance Criteria - 1. Notice of the commencement time of the Contractor's cold planing plant verification process
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
1.3 - Cold planing plant in full working order
Acceptance Criteria - 2. Copy of Contractors’ cold planing verification checklist at the completion of check prior to commencement of each work period
Record of conformity - Submission of Daily Prestart Records / This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
2.0 - Cold Planing in Advance of Asphalt Work
2.1 - Cold planing in advance of asphalt overlay work: Area closed to aircraft traffic.
Frequency - Prior (10 working days) to commencement of planing works

Acceptance Criteria - Proposal to Contract Administrator to texture, profile and mill in advance of asphalt work including complete program and plan of texturing, profiling and milling and asphalt overlay work proposed in the work area.
Record of conformity - Submission of Shift Plan / This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
2.2 - Cold planning in advance of asphalt overlay work: Area open to aircraft traffic.
Frequency - Prior (10 working days) to commencement of planing works

Acceptance Criteria - 1. Proposal to Contract Administrator to texture in advance of asphalt overlay work including date of demonstration and detailed program of texturing and asphalt overlay work in the work area
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
2.3 - Removal of cold planing and asphalt paving equipment from work area
Frequency - Before textured surface is opened to aircraft traffic
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection between Contractor and Contract Administrator of textured area.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
Frequency - Before the commencement of each working period

Acceptance Criteria - Written notification to the Contract Administrator that all plant, equipment and labour, including that required for the placing, compaction and finish of asphalt, are available and ready on-site and supply of asphalt for the work is confirmed even in the event of an unexpected breakdown of the asphalt mixing plant.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
4.0 - Performance Check at Commencement of Work Period
4.1 - Check that planing machines producing compliant surface
Acceptance Criteria - Notice to the Contract Administrator of the commencement time of cold planning
4.1 - Commencement of application of tack coat and asphalt paving
Acceptance Criteria - 1. Notice to the contract Administrator of the scheduled commencement time of Contractor's inspection and checking of the textured surface of the texturing trial.
2. Statement of compliance signed by the Contractors’ PQR that the textured surface in the texturing trial complies with the specified requirements
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
4.2 - Commencement of application of tack coat and asphalt paving
Frequency - Prior to application of tack coat
Acceptance Criteria - Written agreement by Contractor, including photograph and typical measurements of the Texture Reference Area
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
4.3 - Removal of application of cold planing and asphalt paving equipment from work area

Acceptance Criteria - Notice to the Contract Administrator of Contractor's Inspection of completed textured surface and, statement of compliance of textured surface with specified requirements signed by contractor’s PQR
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
5.0 - Profiling, Miling and Cleaning of Cold Planed Surfaces
5.1 - Removal of planing and cleaning equipment from site

Acceptance Criteria - Notice to the Contract Administrator of Contractor's Inspection of completed profiled surface and, statement of compliance of profiled surface with specified requirements signed by contractor’s PQR
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
5.2 - Removal of cold planing and asphalt paving equipment from work area

Acceptance Criteria - Notice to the Contract Administrator of Contractor's Inspection of completed milled surface and, statement of compliance of milled surface with specified requirements signed by contactor’s PQR
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
5.3 - Cleaning of entire cold planned surfaces of asphalt
Acceptance Criteria - Notice to the contract Administrator of commencement of cleaning of cold planed surfaces of asphalt
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
5.4 - Tack coat and placement of asphalt over cold planed surfaces of asphalt
Frequency - At completion of each cleaning working period
Acceptance Criteria - Statement signed by the Contractor's PQR that the whole of the cold planed surfaces of asphalt have been cleaned as specified
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator
Acceptance Criteria - All asphalt removed from pavements by cold planing will become the property of the Contractor and must be removed from the site and disposed of by the Contractor.
○ Stockpiling and material disposal requirements to be confirmed and authorised with Contract Administrator
Reference Documents - Volume 1: 3912 and Volume 2 SP3912
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
7.0 - Survey of Cold Planed Asphalt Surfaces
7.1 - Placing of asphalt over cold- planed asphalt surfaces
Acceptance Criteria - Survey of cold planed asphalt surfaces and determination of overlay thicknesses for asphalt thickness control, and Notice to the contract Administrator of commencement of survey
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrator / Submission of Survey Records.
Acceptance Criteria - Submit detailed information for each shift. Details include location, test certificates etc.
Inspection/Test Method - Review of Lot Submission details
Record of conformity - Lot Submission documents submitted to Contract Administrator
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of any work period
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to movement of any plant on to site of works, submission of daily plant inspection verification checklist
Record of conformity - Plant Inspection verification Checklist

Acceptance Criteria - All asphalt haul trucks must be suitably equipped to avoid spilling the mix in front of the asphalt spreaders. The internal surfaces of the truck bodies must be smooth, clean and uniformly coated with a suitable release agent (nonpetroleum based material) to prevent adhesion of the mixture to the bodies.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The spreaders must be a self- propelled mechanical device designed for spreading, screeding and compacting hot asphalt and having a capacity to complete the planned works within the time available in a paving shift. Specific details are shown in clause 5113 (f)
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Steel wheel rollers must have an all up mass between 6 and 11 t.Vibrating steel wheel rollers must have two (2) vibrating drums each of which must have a roll diameter and width of not less than 1.00 m and 1.37 m respectively, a static mass of at least 2.8 t per lineal m of width of drum, and a dynamic loading intensity under operating conditions of between 4.2 t and 6.8 t per lineal metre of width of drum. When operating in the vibrating mode the amplitude must not exceed 0.5 mm and the frequency of vibration must not be less than 2700 cycles per minute
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Medium pneumatic tyred rollers must be rollers having an all up mass of not less than 18 t and wheel loads of not less than 2.5 t. The tyre pressure must not be less than 850 kPa.
○ The application of water, soaps or propriety additives to the tyres must be the minimum necessary to prevent adhesion /pick- up of the mix.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - At least one steel wheel roller must be fitted with an edge compactor capable of compacting joints and edges of newly placed asphalt between vertical and 45° to the vertical, without dislodging or disturbing the material forming the joint or edge.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Mechanical brooms may be skid steer loaders capable of being fitted with both a bucket and a broom/bucket combination.
○ All brooms/broom stocks must have non-metallic bristles.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - At least one (1) vacuum sweeper must be a machine purpose built to vacuum clean a width of pavement of at least two metres per pass with no reliance on brooming for lateral collection of material. Airfield Schwarze sweepers manufactured by Schwarze Industries Australia, or similar approved, are suitable.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The coring machine must be easily portable and capable of rapidly cutting clean 100 mm or 150 mm diameter cores from the finished courses of asphalt in accordance with the requirements of AS 2891.1.2. The core drills fitted to the machine must be either diamond tipped or carborundum types.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Not less than 1 hand held straight edge must be provided for each operating paver to facilitate the location of defects in the smoothness of the finished surface. Straight edges must be constructed of a material and in a manner that ensures rigidity and accuracy, and must be 3.5m long and must be placed directly onto the mat.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Hand tools must consist of wooden spreaders, shovels, steel lutes and tampers, hand brooms, a portable heater for heating tampers, hand held blowers and any other hand tools as may be required.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must provide one calibrated immersion stem thermometer (0 - 200 °C) and one calibrated pavement surface thermometer (bi-metal or infra-red), (0 - 200 °C), with each operating spreader. The thermometers must be held on site at all times when asphalt is being placed.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - The surface on which the asphalt is to be placed must be essentially dry and free of any surface water.

○ Asphalt must not be placed during periods of rain or when rain is imminent. Any asphalt placed during rain must be removed from the Works and replaced, unless otherwise determined by the Contract Administrator.
○ Asphalt must not be placed if the surface temperature falls below the minimum surface temperature as specified in Table 5115-1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt delivery must adhere to AS 2150 standards, ensuring completion of spreading and compaction by the work period's end. Each truckload requires a docket with details such as truck number, dispatch time, temperature, and mix specifications. Delivery vehicles cannot access freshly laid asphalt, and loads must be covered with heavy canvas and insulated to maintain temperature.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The asphalt mix must be delivered at the minimum temperature specified in Table 5117-1 for the bitumen and must allow for initial compaction before cooling. Loads below this temperature, with cold crusts, wet from rain, or contaminated, must be rejected.
○ Miinimum asphalt temperature for compaction are indicated inTable 5121-1
Reference Documents - Volume 1: Clause 5117 (c), Table 5117-1 and Table 5121-1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Before applying the tack coat, remove loose materials within a 300 mm buffer, using power brooms or hand sweeping if needed. Clean oil spills with detergent and let the area dry. Ensure the surface is dry, debris-free, and mostly dust-free.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Tack coat must be applied to the prepared surfaces such that a uniform cover at the specified application rate over the full surface is achieved.
○ The residual bitumen application rate of emulsion tack coat must be between 0.15 ℓ/m2 and 0.25 ℓ/m2.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt placing must not commence until all of the treatments within the paving lane and adjacent paving lane are completed and inspected by the Contract Administrator.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Adminstrato r
Acceptance Criteria - The minimum and maximum layer thicknesses for different nominal asphalt sizes must be in accordance with Table 5120-1.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The asphalt must be compacted while the mix temperature is above the respective minimum values specified in Table 5121-1 for the relevant bitumen used in the production of the mix and roller type, unless otherwise determined and approved during the construction trials. The asphalt must be compacted with rollers meeting the requirements of Technical Specs, Volume 1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - The contractor must maintain detailed records of the temperatures of the asphalt mix during delivery, placement and compaction and must submit these records as part of the lot submission
Record of conformity - Asphalt Temperature Records (Delivery, placement and Compaction)

Acceptance Criteria - All of the rolling must be performed in a definite pattern previously determined by the Contractor and must be supervised continuously by the Contractor for the duration of the work.
○ The in-situ voids requirements for the asphalt must comply with the requirements of Table 5121-2.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Breakdown rolling requires a non-vibrating steel wheel roller with up to two passes. Start at the lower edge, overlap the lane edges by 200 mm, and progress across, overlapping previous tracks by 100 mm to 200 mm and extending 6 m beyond. For subsequent lanes, start at the free edge and overlap about 100 mm onto the previous lane.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Vibrating rolling follows breakdown rolling. For vibrating steel-wheeled rollers, keep vibration amplitude at or below 0.5 mm, unless the layer thickness exceeds 50 mm, allowing for greater amplitude at the Contractor's discretion.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Pneumatic tyred rolling must follow vibrating rolling, requiring at least six passes before the asphalt cools below the specified temperature showed in Table 5121-1 to ensure a tightly bonded surface.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - All paving joints must match the surrounding surface's texture, density and smoothness.

○ Longitudinal joints between lanes need to ensure a continuous bond and minimized cold joints. If the surface finish is below standard, a non-conformance report must be issued. Longitudinal joints in overlays must be offset by at least 200 mm.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - To treat the joint between asphalt lanes as a warm joint, place the adjoining lane within 1 hour while maintaining the required compaction temperature specified in Table 5121-1. Procedure is detailled in Clause 5122 (b)(ii)
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - Transverse joints must be at right angles to the direction of placing and must be cut to a straight face between vertical and 45° to the vertical to the full depth of the course. Procedure is detailed in Clause 5122 (c)
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
8.0 - Finished Surface Level, Surface Smoothnes and Finish
Frequency - Within one working day of completion of the survey

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must provide the Contract Administrator with a record of the finished surface levels together with a summary indicating the magnitude of the departures from the specified finished surface levels shown on the drawings within one(1) working day of completion of the survey
Acceptance Criteria - The finished surface of all asphalt surfacing courses must not deviate from the testing edge of an approved 3.5 m straight edge by more the requirements in Table 5124-1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection of completed pavement with the Contract Administrator
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
9.1 - Assigned Maximum Density of a lot of Asphalt

Acceptance Criteria - The assigned maximum density for use in the determination of the in- situ voids of an asphalt must be the as defined in Clause 5132(a) of this specification, using cores cut as per Clause 5132(b)
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Frequency - Within one working day of completion of the asphalt work

Acceptance Criteria - Copy of the thickness determinations indicating the magnitude of the depature from the specified thickness, immediately on completion of the determination or within one-working day of completion of the asphalt work and statement of conformance (or non- conformance report and proposed disposition if applicable)
Reference Documents - Volume 1: HP 5132-1 & Clause 5132 (e) Volume 2: Clause SP5132 (e)(iv)
Frequency - Within one (1) working day of conformance

Acceptance Criteria - Record of the finished surface levels together with a summary indicating the magnitude of the departures from the specified finished surface levels shown on the drawings within one (1) working day of conformance (or non-conformance report and proposed disposition if applicable)
Frequency - Within one (1) working day of completion of testing

Acceptance Criteria - Statement of conformance or record and plan of location and extend of surface irregularities that depart from testing edge by more than the tolerances specified within one (1) working day of completion of the surface smoothness testing and non-conformance report and proposed disposition as applicable.
Record of conformity - Straight Edge Testing
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
